meanings.definition: To work in advance or prepare for work.
meanings.sent1: She always likes to preworking on her projects to avoid last-minute stress.
meanings.sent2: I will preworking on the presentation tonight so we can review it tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: He thought preworking was boring until he realized how much time it saved him.
meanings.sent4: Preworking is like laying the foundation before building a house.
meanings.sent5: Remember to preworking on your homework to make sure you have enough time to complete it.

meanings.definition: The act of preparing for work beforehand.
meanings.sent1: His preworking on the project impressed the team with his organization skills.
meanings.sent2: Preworking is essential for a successful and stress-free workday.
meanings.sent3: The office manager's preworking included setting up the meeting room with snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her preworking was like a well-oiled machine, ensuring everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The benefits of preworking are evident in the efficiency of the team's workflow.
